titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Albany County and Rensselaer County Courts records 1977.595
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-18 19:13:40 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Albany County and Rensselaer County Courts records
did.abstract: Various records of the Albany and Rensselaer County Courts, including an affidavit from John Seelye (Albany County), a petition of Jacob Miller (Albany County), and an affidavit from David Bryan (Rensselaer County). Records date from 1793 and 1811.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Albany County and Rensselaer County Courts records, 1977.595, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various records of the Albany and Rensselaer County Courts, including an affidavit from John Seelye (Albany County), a petition of Jacob Miller (Albany County), and an affidavit from David Bryan (Rensselaer County). Records date from 1793 and 1811.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
